net.viktorc.pp4j.api

Interface Command

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCommand, SimpleCommand

    public interface Command
    An interface that defines methods that provide a textual command instruction and allow for the processing of the outputs of the process in response to the instruction. Besides possible processing activities, the isProcessed(String, boolean) method is also responsible for determining when the process finished processing the command. E.g. if a process takes the command "go" which triggers the execution of a long-running task, and it prints "ready" to its standard out stream once the task is completed, the method should only return true if the output "ready" has been written to the standard out, in any other case, it should return false (unless perhaps an error message is printed to the standard error stream). The interface also defines a method that is called before the execution of chained commands with the previous command as its parameter to determine whether the current command should be executed based on the results of the previous commands.
    Author:
    Viktor Csomor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default boolean doExecute(List<Command> prevCommands)
      A method called before the execution of every command, except the first one, in a submission containing multiple commands.

      Returns the instruction to write to the process' standard in.
      boolean isProcessed(String outputLine, boolean standard)

    • Method Detail

      • getInstruction

        String getInstruction()
        Returns the instruction to write to the process' standard in.
        Returns:
        The instruction to write to the process' standard in.

      • generatesOutput

        boolean generatesOutput()
        A method called before the issuing of the instruction. It denotes whether the command is expected to generate output. If it returns false, the command is considered processed as soon as it is written to the process' standard in and therefore the process is considered ready for new commands right away. If it returns true, the isProcessed(String, boolean) method determines when the command is deemed processed.
        Returns:
        Whether the executing process is expected to generate output in response to the command.

      • isProcessed

        boolean isProcessed(String outputLine,
                    boolean standard)
        A method called every time a new line is printed to the standard out or standard error stream of the process after the command has been sent to its standard in until the method returns true.
        Parameters:
        outputLine - The new line of output printed to the standard out of the process.
        standard - Whether this line has been output to the standard out or to the standard error stream.
        Returns:
        Whether this line of output denotes that the process has finished processing the command. The ProcessExecutor instance executing the command will not accept new commands until the processing of the command is completed.

      • doExecute

        default boolean doExecute(List<Command> prevCommands)
        A method called before the execution of every command, except the first one, in a submission containing multiple commands. It determines whether the command is to be executed. This allows for the establishment of conditions on which certain commands should be executed. If a submission contains only a single command, this method is not called at all. By default, it returns true in all cases.
        Parameters:
        prevCommands - The commands preceding this one in the submission that have already been executed and processed or skipped if their respective doExecute(List) methods returned false.
        Returns:
        Whether this command should be executed.
